meanings.definition: To send (something) to the wrong recipient or address.
meanings.sent1: I missend my letter to the wrong house.
meanings.sent2: She always double-checks the address to avoid missending packages.
meanings.sent3: The cat missending the ball into the neighbor's yard made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her absent-mindedness led to missending important documents, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The image of missending a love letter to her boss stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: The act of sending something to the wrong recipient or address.
meanings.sent1: The missending of the package resulted in a delay.
meanings.sent2: He was frustrated by the constant missending of his emails.
meanings.sent3: The missending of the invitation added a comical twist to the event.
meanings.sent4: The missending of signals between the two countries caused confusion.
meanings.sent5: The company implemented new procedures to prevent missending in the future.
